intro: Elaphrium rubrum, commonly known as the red elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Elaphrium rubrum is often grown in shaded gardens due to its preference for moist, well-drained soil and partial shade.
